brief_summary.textblock:
Chest physiotherapy is recognized as a mainstay of cystic fibrosis therapy, and is
      particularly important during treatment of pulmonary exacerbations.  For some patients,
      especially those with moderate to severe compromise of lung function, this therapy may
      impose a high demand in the work of breathing and energy expenditure.  The goal of this
      study is to evaluate the effectiveness of adding pressure support ventilation (PSV) during
      chest physiotherapy sessions in patients with cystic fibrosis with moderate to severe lung
      function compromise being treated for a pulmonary exacerbation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pressure Support Ventilation During CF Exacerbations

detailed_description.textblock:
The proposed study will be conducted over three years.  Cystic fibrosis patients with
      moderate to severe pulmonary disease who are experiencing an acute exacerbation that
      requires hospitalization will be admitted to the GCRC.  Subject participation in the study
      will be for the first 10 days of hospitalization.  Subjects will be randomized into one of
      two treatment groups: usual care or usual care plus non-invasive pressure support
      ventilation (PSV).

criteria.textblock: cystic fibrosis subjects with pulmonary exacerbation

clinical_study.official_title: Pressure Support Ventilation During CF Exacerbations: A Randomized, Controlled Trial

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
